revised_title: Neutron-Proton Scattering at Small Angles: Experimental Techniques and Findings
tldr: This article presents an experimental study of neutron-proton scattering at small angles using a liquid hydrogen target and a scintillation counter. The authors measured the absolute differential cross-section for scattering at various angles and energies, finding a characteristic minimum at 90 degrees. They also discussed the experimental setup, including the neutron source, the liquid hydrogen target, the scintillation counter, and the electronic apparatus. The results provide valuable data for understanding nuclear interactions and improving nuclear physics models.
